173.article_body: Presenting the Kerala Budget for 2022-23 on Friday, state Finance Minister KN Balagopal said ₹10 crore has been earmarked to help the students, who returned to the state in wake of Russia's invasion of Ukraine, to continue their studies. Balagopal added that 3,123 people have returned safely to the state through various flights, including 15 chartered flights, amid the crisis.

174.title: Deeply concerned over laws targeting LGBTQ+ in US : Apple CEO
174.article_body: Apple CEO Tim Cook has expressed his concerns over US laws targeting the LGBTQ+ community amid controversy on a US bill that prohibits classroom discussion of sexual orientation and gender identity for many young students. "As a proud member of...LGBTQ+ community, I am deeply concerned about laws being enacted across the country," Cook said. Florida lawmakers passed the bill earlier.

175.title: UP is just a tableau, Maharashtra is yet to come: Fadnavis
175.article_body: A day after the BJP won a majority in three states in the Assembly polls, ex-Maharashtra CM Devendra Fadnavis said that "now the fight will be in Mumbai", referring to the upcoming municipal polls. "We won't be against any party, we'll be against bribery & corruption...Uttar Pradesh is just a tableau, Maharashtra is yet to come," the BJP leader added.

176.title: Naxal commander carrying ₹3 lakh reward killed in encounter in Chhattisgarh
176.article_body: A Naxal commander, carrying a reward of ₹3 lakh on his head, was killed in an encounter in Chhattisgarh's Bijapur district on Friday, an official said. According to police, the encounter took place near Mosla where an armed group opened fire on the patrolling team. A jawan of the District Reserve Guard (DRG) was injured in the operation, police added.

177.title: Samajwadi Party leader attempts self-immolation after party's defeat in UP polls
177.article_body: The Vice President of Samajwadi Party's (SP) Kanpur unit, Narendra Singh alias Pintu, allegedly attempted suicide by setting himself on fire outside the Vidhan Bhavan in Lucknow on Thursday, police said. The incident took place after SP lost the Uttar Pradesh election to the BJP. Singh has suffered 30% burn injuries and is stated to be in a critical condition.

178.title: Canada restaurant changes signature dish's name from 'The Vladimir' to 'The Volodymyr'
178.article_body: A Canadian restaurant chain that makes a local delicacy of fries topped with gravy and cheese curds has changed the name of its signature dish following customer complaints after Russia's war with Ukraine. Frite Alors! used to call the dish "The Vladimir" after the Russian President. The dish is now called "The Volodymyr" in honour of Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy.

179.title: UNSC to discuss US, Ukraine biowarfare labs at Russia's request
179.article_body: The United Nations Security Council (UNSC) will meet on Friday to discuss Russia's claims about alleged US "military biological activities" in Ukraine. Russia's request for the UNSC meet came after the US rejected Moscow's accusations that the US was operating biological warfare labs in Ukraine and suggested Russia may be laying the groundwork to use a chemical or biological weapon.

180.title: Delhi University teachers to hold protests over multiple issues
180.article_body: The Delhi University Teachers' Association (DUTA) will conduct a series of protests over multiple issues including the merger of the College of Art with Ambedkar University and the absorption of ad-hoc teachers. According to DUTA President AK Bhagi, the association will conduct a dharna on March 22 followed by college-wise demonstrations in multiple phases on March 25, 28 and 29.

181.title: Russian missile strikes house in Ukraine killing 11 of 12 family members, pics surface
181.article_body: A Russian missile hit a house in Ukraine's Marhalivka, killing 11 of the 12 family members. Ukraine's Ministry of Foreign Affairs shared pictures of the man and his cat who survived the strike. The ministry revealed that the man and his family had left Kyiv to be safe. The man lost his wife, daughter, mother-in-law, sister, sons-in-law, grandchildren and nieces.

182.title: Couldn't process what was happening: Deepika recalls her 1st meeting with SRK
182.article_body: Deepika Padukone, who made her Bollywood debut in 2007 with Shah Rukh Khan-starrer 'Om Shanti Om', revealed that she was "almost in a daze" when she first met the actor. Calling him "India's biggest superstar", she said, "I remember just sitting at the edge of...sofa, being so nervous, and almost in a daze. I couldn't even process what was happening."

183.title: B'luru metro train flagged off with Azadi Ka Amrit Mahotsav images
183.article_body: Bangalore Metro Rail Corporation Limited (BMRCL) Managing Director Anjum Parwez has flagged off a metro train wrapped with Azadi Ka Amrit Mahotsav graphics in Bengaluru. A video of the event shows people waving green flags as the train begins its trip. Earlier, a study showed that metro trains have significantly contributed to the reduction of carbon emission in the city.

184.title: Destroy high-threat pathogens in labs as they may be bombed: WHO to Ukraine
184.article_body: The WHO has asked Ukraine to destroy high-threat pathogens in labs to prevent "any potential spills" as the facilities may be bombed amid Russia's attack. Biosecurity experts have said that Russia's movement of troops into Ukraine and bombardment of its cities have raised the risk of an escape of disease-causing pathogens.

185.title: Delhi Police personnel who violate traffic rules could be fined double
185.article_body: Delhi Additional CP Traffic Ajay Krishan Sharma issued an order warning the police personnel that a double penalty will be imposed against them if found violating traffic rules. This comes after there were numerous complaints on social media against traffic rule violations by Delhi Police personnel. He has also instructed traffic police to prosecute police officers who violate traffic rules.

186.title: Lava flows as Indonesia's Mount Merapi continues to erupt
186.article_body: Indonesia's most active volcano Mount Merapi on Java island continued to erupt on Friday, forcing local authorities to halt tourism and mining activities on the slopes of the volcano. The volcano began unleashing clouds of hot ash and lava before midnight on Wednesday. Mount Merapi's last major eruption was in 2010, in which more than 345 people were killed.

187.title: Masaba says she gets roles of 'girl with acne or with troubled childhood'
187.article_body: Masaba Gupta, when asked about the kind of roles she was offered earlier in her career, said, "No roles were coming my way." "Even today, whatever is coming is very like 'somebody who'd troubled childhood, or acne'," she said, adding, "I don't think I ever get a role that's...focus of a man's life [or] where I can be romanced."

188.title: Every player except Jadeja will still be kicking themselves: Russel
188.article_body: Discussing Team India's first Test against Sri Lanka, ex-Sri Lankan cricketer Russel Arnold said every Indian player barring Ravindra Jadeja will still be "kicking themselves". "Even Rishabh Pant [who scored 96 runs in the first innings of the opening Test]," added Russel. "Pathum Nissanka is struggling, that's a big blow [for Sri Lanka]," stated Russel.

189.title: PM Modi assures support to AAP in Punjab, Kejriwal says 'Thank you, sir'
189.article_body: Hours after Prime Minister Narendra Modi congratulated the Aam Aadmi Party (AAP) on Twitter for its victory in Punjab Assembly elections, AAP chief and Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal on Friday said, "Thank you, sir." "I assure all possible support from the Centre for Punjab's welfare," the Prime Minister had written on Twitter on Thursday.

190.title: PM holds roadshow in Gujarat after BJP returns to power in 4 states
190.article_body: PM Narendra Modi on Friday held a roadshow in Gujarat's Ahmedabad after BJP won Assembly elections in UP, Uttarakhand and Manipur, and became the single largest party in Goa. Gujarat CM Bhupendra Patel and state BJP president CR Paatil were accompanying PM Modi. PM will address Gujarat Panchayat Mahasammelan which will be attended by over one lakh Panchayati Raj representatives.

191.title: I will be editing photos during quarantine: PBKS coach Anil Kumble
191.article_body: Discussing his plans for the three days of "hard quarantine" before Punjab Kings' (PBKS) training for IPL 2022 begins, PBKS coach Anil Kumble who is passionate about photography said he will be "editing" his photos. IPL 2022 will begin on March 26 with defending champions CSK taking on IPL 2021 runners-up KKR in the first match.

192.title: Govt invites applications from drone industry for ₹120 cr PLI scheme
192.article_body: The government has invited applications for the production-linked incentive (PLI) scheme for drones and drone components. Last year, the Cabinet had cleared a PLI scheme worth ₹120 crore for drone industry. Under the scheme, the incentive for a manufacturer of drones and drone components will be 20% of the "value addition" made by the company during the next three years.

193.title: Maha Traffic Police collects e-challan dues worth ₹57.15 cr in a month
193.article_body: The Maharashtra Highway Police collected e-challan dues worth ₹57.15 crore from 11.60 lakh motorists in a month's time. This comes after the police issued pre-litigation notices to the defaulters asking them to be present before the court on March 12 for non-payment of e-challans. The Highway Traffic Police had started this exercise of serving pre-litigation notices to motorists in 2021.

194.title: Pune policeman arrested for forging service record to apply for President's medal
194.article_body: A havaldar attached to Pune City Police's special branch has been arrested for allegedly forging his service record while submitting the application for the President's Police Medal for meritorious service. Along with the policeman, three others, including two clerks and the policeman's aide, who was the daybook in-charge at Wanwadi police station in 2019, were booked for cheating and forgery.

195.title: Punjab CM Channi submits resignation to Governor after defeat in polls
195.article_body: Punjab Chief Minister Charanjit Singh Channi on Friday submitted his resignation to Governor Banwarilal Purohit after Congress' defeat in the Assembly elections. Congress won 18 seats in the polls, with Channi losing from both Chamkaur Sahib and Bhadaur. Congress' Punjab chief Navjot Singh also lost from the Amritsar East seat.

196.title: Miss Bikini Universe India 2018 and Congress' Archana gets 1,519 votes in UP polls
196.article_body: Miss Bikini Universe India 2018 and Congress candidate from Uttar Pradesh's Hastinapur, Archana Gautam, got only 1,519 votes in the Assembly elections. BJP candidate Dinesh won from Hastinapur with 1,07,587 votes, while SP candidate Yogesh Verma received 1,00,275 votes. Gautam thanked the people who voted for her.

197.title: Russian forces attack Kharkiv institute housing nuclear reactor: Ukraine
197.article_body: Ukraine has accused Russia of "nuclear terrorism" after Russian forces shelled an institute in Ukraine's second-largest city Kharkiv, which houses a nuclear reactor. The shelling caused a fire in a neighbouring hostel, which has now been put out. Russian forces have already taken over two nuclear power plants in Ukraine, raising concerns about the security of the nuclear facilities.

198.title: Ian Healy criticised for 'Not surprised' comment on Shane Warne's demise
198.article_body: Former Australia wicketkeeper Ian Healy has been criticised for his remark on Shane Warne's demise wherein he said that Shane's "early passing" didn't surprise him as he "didn't look after his body". "Healy, pull your head in. The time to make a claim that you were 'right' here is ill-timed," a fan said. "How disgraceful of Healy!" wrote another.

199.title: Online registration for Amarnath yatra to begin from April
199.article_body: Shri Amarnath Shrine Board (SASB) will begin online registrations for Amarnath yatra from April, the board confirmed on Thursday. "The online registration will start through banks in the month of April 2022 with a limit of 20,000 registrations fixed per day," SASB official said. The pilgrims can also make on-spot registration at designated counters during yatra days, he added.

200.title: SC to hear plea against Ashish Mishra's bail on March 15 in Lakhimpur case
200.article_body: Supreme Court said that it will hear a plea challenging the bail granted to Minister of State for Home Affairs Ajay Mishra Teni's son, Ashish Mishra on March 15. He is the prime accused in the Lakhimpur Kheri violence case. Ashish was arrested in October 2021 after at least four farmers and a journalist were killed in UP's Lakhimpur Kheri.

201.title: No global firm can touch Russia's blood money, thank you Mastercard: Ukraine Vice PM
201.article_body: Days after Mastercard suspended its operations in Russia, Ukraine's Vice Prime Minister Mykhailo Fedorov said, "I'm sure...no global company can touch Russia's blood money as long as its tanks and missiles kill Ukrainians." "Thank you, Mastercard, for the first steps towards peace, but have you terminated all financial contracts with Russia?" he wrote on Twitter.

202.title: India becomes world's 5th most-valued stock market, beats UK: Report
202.article_body: India has become the fifth most-valued stock market, beating the UK, Canada and Saudi Arabia, Moneycontrol reported. The Indian market has lost around $257.35 billion since the start of 2022 amid Russia's invasion of Ukraine and its value is currently above $3 trillion. The US stock market, which is world's most-valued at $47.32 trillion, has lost $6.6 trillion this year.

203.title: Saheb's clever attempt: Political strategist Prashant Kishor on PM's 2024 remark
203.article_body: After PM Narendra Modi said that 2022 UP election results have decided 2024 Lok Sabha results, political strategist Prashant Kishor tweeted, "Battle for India will be fought and decided in 2024 & not in any state elections." "Saheb knows this! Hence this clever attempt to create frenzy around state results to establish a decisive psychological advantage over opposition," he wrote.

204.title: New IT park, 4 IT corridors, 20 satellite IT hubs proposed in Kerala Budget
204.article_body: Kerala Finance Minister KN Balagopal, while presenting the state Budget for 2022-23 in Assembly on Friday, proposed to set up a new IT park, four IT corridors and 20 satellite IT hubs. Balagopal added that ₹100 crore has been set aside for the expansion of the IT parks and ₹1,000 crore has been earmarked for land acquisition in the sector.

205.title: Police lathi-charge SP-RLD supporters after they pelt stones in UP
205.article_body: Police lathi-charged SP-RLD supporters in Uttar Pradesh's Baghpat on Thursday after they tried to forcefully enter a vote counting centre and pelted stones at police officers. Three police officers and six SP-RLD supporters were injured. The SP-RLD supporters had allegedly been angered after the BJP candidate defeated the SP candidate from the Baraut seat with a margin of 315 votes.

206.title: Crypto brain drain is crazy in India: Dubai-based Polygon Co-founder
206.article_body: Dubai-based blockchain platform Polygon Co-founder Sandeep Nailwal while discussing India's cryptocurrency sector and its regulations said, "The brain drain is absolutely crazy." He discussed how developers, investors and entrepreneurs are leaving for places with more friendly regulation. He said he wishes to stay in India and promote the Web3 ecosystem but regulatory uncertainty is a hurdle.

207.title: Kerala HC allows 10-year-old rape survivor to terminate pregnancy
207.article_body: The Kerala High Court allowed medical termination of the 30-week-old pregnancy of a 10-year-old rape survivor. A medical board constituted to examine the victim, had said that an operative delivery was needed and there is an 80% chance of the baby surviving. "The court should invoke the jurisdiction, in this case, keeping in mind the Almighty," the bench said.

208.title: Biopic on Indian spy Ravindra Kaushik starring Salman shelved: Reports
208.article_body: A biopic on Indian spy Ravindra Kaushik, who was known as Black Tiger, has reportedly been shelved. Salman Khan had announced the project last year. According to reports, filmmaker Raj Kumar Gupta had the rights for five years which have now expired. The reports also mentioned that the 'Ek Tha Tiger' actor was also apprehensive about playing another spy.

209.title: It needs to be second nature: Karthik on Pant's 'technical flaw'
209.article_body: Dinesh Karthik termed Rishabh Pant's inability to get his hands in the right position previously as a "technical flaw", adding that it needs to be "second nature" because of the lack of time. "He has worked on that. It takes...time to settle in," stated Karthik. "Repetition is very important..., the amount of work he has put in...is reflecting," said Karthik.

210.title: Railway operations disrupted after crude bomb found on tracks in Bihar
210.article_body: Railway operations were disrupted for at least two hours after a crude bomb was found on the railway tracks near Guraru railway station in Bihar's Gaya district, according to police. The bomb was found within 100 metres of the railway station, Gaya ASP Manish Kumar said. The explosive was defused by the bomb squad on the tracks.

211.title: UP elections result a lesson, should learn from it: BSP chief Mayawati
211.article_body: Bahujan Samaj Party (BSP) chief Mayawati said that the 2022 Uttar Pradesh Assembly elections result is a lesson. "We should not be discouraged by it. Instead, we should learn from it, introspect...carry forward our party movement, and come back to power," she added. "Negative campaigns succeeded in misleading...that BSP is BJP's B-team...while the truth is opposite," Mayawati further said.

212.title: Hyderabad City Police arrest 3 for possessing, selling drugs
212.article_body: The Hyderabad City Police on Thursday arrested three people for possessing drugs and seized four hash oil bottles weighing 20 ml. According to Lallaguda SHO Madhulatha, the accused were apprehended in Lalapet where they were trying to sell the drugs to needy customers. Police also seized three mobile phones used in the commission of the offence.

213.title: How did the top 3 richest candidates perform in Punjab Assembly elections?
213.article_body: AAP's Kulwant Singh, richest candidate in Punjab Assembly elections with over ₹238-crore assets, won SAS Nagar seat by beating Congress' Balbir Singh Sidhu by 34,097 votes. SAD leader and ex-Deputy CM Sukhbir Singh Badal, second-richest candidate with ₹202-crore assets, lost from Jalalabad to AAP's Jagdeep Kamboj by 30,930 votes. Congress' Karan Kaur, third-richest candidate, lost from Muktsar.

214.title: Untrained people won't be sent to frontlines: Ukraine Defence Min
214.article_body: Ukraine's Defence Minister Oleksii Reznikov said that more than 1,00,000 Ukrainians have joined the country's territorial defence unit. However, he added that untrained civilians taking up arms against Russia won't be sent into frontline battles. "It doesn't make any sense...Being outnumbered, our army is still stopping enemy forces because it's motivated, better trained and armed," Reznikov said.

215.title: All artists are equal: Big B as a fan compares him to other actors
215.article_body: Amitabh Bachchan responded to a fan who praised his performance in the recently released film 'Jhund' and tweeted, "A man in 80 delivers a new level Cinema...much better than 30-60 heroes giving nowadays." The fan added that 'Jhund' is a "clean family film with a concrete message". "Humbled and embarrassed by...comparison. All artists are equal...please don't give comparisons," Amitabh wrote.

216.title: How did the top 3 richest candidates perform in UP Assembly elections?
216.article_body: Congress' Nawab Kazim Ali Khan, the richest candidate with over ₹296-crore assets, lost from Rampur seat after receiving 4,000 votes. AIMIM's Shah Alam, the second-richest candidate with assets over ₹195 crore, lost from Mubarakpur after receiving fourth-highest votes (36,460). SP's Supriya Aron, the third-richest candidate with assets over ₹157 crore, lost from Bareilly Cantt by 10,768 votes.

217.title: Social media users criticise Ola for its '8 missed calls from mom' notification
217.article_body: Social media users have criticised Ola after it sent a notification that read '8 missed calls from mom'. Ola sent the notification to promote 40% discount on certain services. "Why is Ola traumatising me like this?" a user asked, while another user wrote, "Ola, are you trying to give me a heart attack?"

218.title: 16-year-old girl raped by 4 men over 6 days in B'luru; 6 arrested
218.article_body: Six people, including two women, have been arrested after a 16-year-old girl was allegedly raped by four men over six days in Bengaluru, police said on Friday. The women reportedly sold the girl to people after threatening her. One of the women also apparently laced the girl's drink with sedatives and when she woke up, she found bloodstains on herself.

219.title: Unarmed Indian supersonic missile landed on our soil: Pakistan
219.article_body: Pakistan has claimed that an unarmed Indian supersonic missile landed on its soil on Wednesday evening. Pakistan said that the missile was cruising at an altitude of 40,000 feet and endangered passenger flights in both Indian and Pakistani airspace, and also civilians and property on the ground. There were no human casualties.

220.title: Man held for false bomb blast threat at Mumbai University campus
220.article_body: A man was arrested for allegedly making a false bomb blast threat at Mumbai University campus, police said on Thursday. "A man called police control room on Wednesday evening and threatened to blow Mumbai University Campus within 10 minutes," an officer told ANI. However, police found nothing upon inspection. The accused was arrested from Santacruz area of Mumbai, police added.

221.title: Mayawati, Owaisi contributed to BJP's win in UP: Sanjay Raut
221.article_body: Shiv Sena leader Sanjay Raut on Friday said that BSP chief Mayawati and AIMIM chief Asaduddin Owaisi contributed to BJP's win in the 2022 Uttar Pradesh Assembly elections. "They must be given Padma Vibhushan and Bharat Ratna," he added. "BJP achieved a great victory. UP was their state, still, Akhilesh Yadav's seats have increased three times," Raut further said.

222.title: Woman constable accuses police inspector of raping her in B'luru, lodges FIR
222.article_body: A female police constable accused a police inspector of rape on the pretext of marriage in Bengaluru. The constable has filed an FIR against the inspector, attached to the State Intelligence Department, in which she has further accused him of threatening her and forcing her to swallow pills for abortion. The Govindarajnagar Police Station is conducting the investigation.

223.title: Extremist acts: Russia on Meta allowing posts seeking Putin's death
223.article_body: The Russian embassy in the US has asked the government to stop the "extremist activities" of Facebook-parent Meta after it temporarily lifted a ban on posts calling for Russian President Vladimir Putin's death. "Meta's...criminal policy leading to incitement of...hostility towards Russians is outrageous," the embassy said. Meta said it won't allow "credible" calls for violence against civilians.

224.title: Russia bans export of 200 products till end of 2022 amid sanctions
224.article_body: Russia has banned the export of over 200 products till the end of this year after the US, EU and others hit the country with sanctions over the invasion of Ukraine. The ban covers telecoms, medical, auto, agricultural and electrical equipment and some forestry products like timber. The measure is necessary "to maintain stability on the Russian market", it said.

225.title: National Lok Adalat to be held in all courts in Pune tomorrow
225.article_body: National Lok Adalat will be organised at all the courts in Pune tomorrow. During this, courts will take up 45,000 pending cases from the district and 1.75 lakh pre-litigation cases that had been kept for compromise. An arrangement has also been made for paying the compromise and penalties in the cases through e-challans in the National Lok Adalat.

226.title: No chemical weapons were developed on my land: Ukraine Prez Zelenskyy
226.article_body: Ukraine President Volodymyr Zelenskyy refuted Russia's claims that Ukraine is developing biological weapons and is planning "chemical attack". "No chemical or any other weapons of mass destruction were developed on my land," he said. The accusations "makes me...worried because we've been repeatedly convinced, if you want to know Russia's plans, look at what it accuses others of [doing]", he added.

227.title: 5 men rob ₹1.1 cr at gunpoint, donate ₹1 lakh at temple in Delhi; held
227.article_body: Delhi Police arrested five men a week after they allegedly robbed two employees of a businessman of ₹1.1 crore in Delhi's Civil Lines area. The accused had also donated ₹1 lakh of the robbed amount at a temple, police said. "The accused pulled out their pistols, threatened the victims and took the bags with money," police added.

228.title: Can sit together without masks due to PM Modi's efforts: JP Nadda
228.article_body: BJP President JP Nadda lauded PM Narendra Modi's effort in tackling the COVID-19 situation in India and said that it's because of him that now we can sit close to each other without wearing masks. "Over 180 crore people have been prepared (to fight COVID) by giving COVID vaccination...at a time when western countries find themselves in trouble," he added.

229.title: Calcutta HC stays Bengal's order suspending internet during Madhyamik exams
229.article_body: The Calcutta High Court imposed an interim stay on West Bengal government's order suspending internet connectivity in parts of the state on the days of Madhyamik (Class 10 state board) examinations. The order was challenged by the Internet Freedom Foundation (IFF) on the ground that such an order couldn't have been issued by the state under Section 144 of CrPC.

230.title: It was his concern for us that claimed his life: Friend of Indian killed in Ukraine
230.article_body: Talking about 21-year-old Indian student Naveen Shekharappa Gyanagoudar who was killed in shelling in Ukraine, his friend Amit Vaishyar said, "We were out of food and water...He went early in the morning to bring food." Vaishyar added, "It was his concern towards us that claimed his life. Usually, two people go to fetch food, but that day, he was alone."

231.title: 33-yr-old Indian-American among 2 indicted in US for crypto money laundering
231.article_body: A US court has indicted two people, including an Indian-American, for their roles in a cryptocurrency money laundering scheme. If convicted, 75-year-old Lois Boyd and 33-year-old Manik Mehtani, both from Virginia, could face up to 20 years in federal prison. In the course of their operation, Boyd, Mehtani and their co-conspirators allegedly laundered over $750,000, federal prosecutors alleged.

232.title: Nitin Gadkari thanks people who voted for BJP in Assembly polls
232.article_body: As BJP retained all four states it ruled in the Assembly elections, Union Minister Nitin Gadkari thanked the voters for voting in favour of the saffron party. He further said, "The success that BJP has achieved is because of the work in these states under the leadership of PM Modi. People have given their support...through this victory."

233.title: What were the final results of the Assembly elections in 5 states?
233.article_body: Election Commission has declared final results of Assembly elections held in Uttar Pradesh, Punjab, Uttarakhand, Goa and Manipur. BJP won the elections in UP with 255 seats, while Aam Aadmi Party won in Punjab with 92 seats. In Uttarakhand, BJP won with 47 seats. BJP became the single largest party in Goa, however it could not attain the majority mark.

234.title: Supreme Court issues notice on MediaOne TV's plea challenging ban
234.article_body: Supreme Court on Thursday issued notice on a plea challenging Malayalam news channel MediaOne TV's ban. "The respondents shall produce all the relevant files on which reliance is placed by Kerala HC in the impugned judgement on the next date of listing," SC said. Centre had banned the telecast of MediaOne TV, which is backed by Jamaat-e-Islami, citing security reasons.

235.title: India is good at managing finances but global energy price rise will impact it: IMF
235.article_body: IMF's Managing Director Kristalina Georgieva has said that "India has been very good in managing its finances" but the surge in global energy prices will have a negative impact on the Indian economy. The price rise amid Russia's invasion of Ukraine has "implications on the purchasing power of Indian households", IMF's First Deputy MD Gita Gopinath said during a roundtable.

236.title: BJP won polls because of good governance: Sarbananda Sonowal
236.article_body: Union Minister Sarbananda Sonowal credited BJP's "good governance" after the party retained all four states it ruled in the Assembly elections. "The Central government under the leadership of PM Narendra Modi focussed on giving good governance so that livelihood of the people can be improved and social security can be provided to the people," Sonowal said.

237.title: TSRTC begins baby stroller services at Mahatma Gandhi Bus Station in Hyd
237.article_body: The Telangana State Road Transport Corporation (TSRTC) has started a baby stroller service at Mahatma Gandhi Bus Station in Hyderabad for the convenience of women passengers carrying luggage and travelling with children at the same time. TSRTC Regional Manager said the bus station is very huge and it gets difficult for elderly and women to carry children along with luggage.

238.title: US includes $14 billion for war-hit Ukraine in $1.5 trillion spending bill
238.article_body: The US Congress has passed $1.5 trillion spending bill, including almost $14 billion in humanitarian and military aid to war-hit Ukraine. "We're keeping our promise to support Ukraine as they fight for their lives against the evil Vladimir Putin," Chuck Schumer, the leader of the Senate Democrats, said in a statement

239.title: I was bullied in school, once wore mom's makeup to look lighter: Masaba
239.article_body: Fashion designer Masaba Gupta, daughter of Neena Gupta and former West Indies cricketer Vivian Richards, recalled having issues with her appearance and being bullied in her school for the same. She revealed that she once used her mother's foundation to lighten the colour of her skin. "I didn't realise...it's not...colour of my skin...I went to school...everyone...figured it out," Masaba said.

240.title: We've shown BJP's seats can be reduced: SP chief on UP poll results
240.article_body: Following Uttar Pradesh Assembly election results, SP chief Akhilesh Yadav on Friday tweeted that his party has "shown that BJP's seat count can be reduced and that the fall will continue". He also thanked the people for increasing "SP seats by 2.5 times and vote share by 1.5 times". BJP won 255 assembly seats in UP, while SP secured 111.

241.title: Paragliding banned until further orders in Himachal's Kangra after 2 deaths
241.article_body: All paragliding activities have been banned in Himachal Pradesh's Kangra by the District Administration until further orders. The ban has been put under Disaster Management Act. The decision came after two people died and one was seriously injured after they fell off a paraglider while taking off in Bir Billing of Kangra district on Tuesday.

242.title: Djokovic one of the few players who can cause problems for Nadal: Evert
242.article_body: Discussing Novak Djokovic who is expected to play in French Open 2022, 18-time Grand Slam champion Chris Evert said Djokovic is one of the few players who can cause problems for Rafael Nadal on clay. Daniil Medvedev recently replaced Djokovic as world number one men's tennis player. France has dropped its vaccine pass rule resulting in an opportunity for Djokovic.

243.title: Number of vehicles on Mumbai's road crosses 42-lakh mark: Survey
243.article_body: The number of vehicles on roads of Mumbai has crossed the 42-lakh mark, Maharashtra government's Economic Survey 2022 revealed.  This is 10.3% of the total number of vehicles in Maharashtra standing at 4.09 crore. According to the report, the number of electric vehicles has increased in Maharashtra with over 46,000 e-vehicles registered across the state as of December 2021.

244.title: ISIS confirms death of its leader Abu Ibrahim, names new chief
244.article_body: The Islamic State has confirmed the death of its leader Abu Ibrahim Al-hashemi Al-Quraishi and its spokesperson Abu Hamza Al-Quraishi. The Islamic State further named Abu Al-Hassan Al-hashemi Al-Quraishi as its new chief. This comes after the US administration said that Abu Ibrahim died in a US special forces raid in northern Syria in February.

245.title: Twitter to label Belarus state media's posts, limit their spread
245.article_body: Twitter will be labelling and limiting the spread of posts from Belarus state media and their senior staff, aiming to curb misinformation. It will label about 15 Belarusian outlets, including news agency BelTa, which has nearly 37,000 followers on the service. Twitter's head of site integrity Yoel Roth said the outlets and their Russian affiliates have "engaged in information warfare".

246.title: MediBuddy unveils #HealthUnlimited campaign featuring Amitabh Bachchan
246.article_body: Digital healthcare platform MediBuddy has unveiled its campaign #HealthUnlimited featuring Amitabh Bachchan. Its brand film aims to convey that common health issues can arise at any time, affecting anyone. It advocates prioritizing your health along with your loved ones with MediBuddy Gold, promising unlimited expert doctor consultations across 18 departments, 24/7 for health-related situations.

247.title: Aditya Narayan shares glimpse of his newborn daughter Tvisha
247.article_body: Singer and host Aditya Narayan took to Instagram to share the first glimpse of his newborn daughter Tvisha. "Grateful, lucky, blessed! Going to spend the next few weeks with my angels. See you soon, digital world," he wrote. Earlier, Aditya had revealed that Tvisha was born on February 24. "Shweta and I feel extremely blessed," he had said.

248.title: Which party got how many votes in Uttar Pradesh Assembly elections?
248.article_body: BJP, which emerged as the single-largest party with 255 seats in the Uttar Pradesh Assembly elections, also had the highest vote share of 41.3% (38,051,721 votes). SP, which won 111 seats, had a vote share of 32.1% (29,543,934 votes). BSP had a vote share of 12.9%, while Congress had a vote share of 2.3%.

249.title: 'Gangubai Kathiawadi' crosses ₹100-crore mark, Alia Bhatt celebrates with vegan burger
249.article_body: Actress Alia Bhatt took to Instagram Stories to share that her film 'Gangubai Kathiawadi' has crossed ₹100-crore mark at the domestic box office. She also shared pictures of herself having vegan burger to celebrate the milestone. "Happy century to Gangubai & happy vegan burger + fry to Alia...Thank you for all the love," she wrote.

250.title: Better.com CEO Vishal Garg offers to cover insurance for fired expecting parents
250.article_body: Better.com's CEO Vishal Garg said he'll pay insurance expenses for a group of expectant parents, who lost their jobs as the company fired around 3,000 US and India employees this week. The mortgage lending startup is offering extended medical benefits to 19 expecting parents, an internal communication said. Earlier, Garg was criticised for firing 900 employees on a Zoom call.

251.title: Hrithik, Deepika's 'Fighter' release postponed, film to release in Sep 2023
251.article_body: The makers of Hrithik Roshan and Deepika Padukone-starrer 'Fighter' have announced a new release date of the film. The action thriller, which was earlier supposed to release on January 26, 2023, will now hit the screens on September 28, 2023. In addition to Hrithik and Deepika, it'll also feature Anil Kapoor. 'Fighter' marks the first collaboration between Hrithik and Deepika.

252.title: Theft suspect kills self in Mumbai, family alleges police harassment
252.article_body: A 23-year-old man, suspected of stealing a bike, allegedly died by suicide at his residence in Mumbai's Dahisar on Wednesday. Victim Raj Pawar's family alleged he took the step after being harassed by the police a day before. "An enquiry has been set up under assistant commissioner of police to probe the grievance," zonal DCP Somnath Gharge said.

253.title: How does the Women's World Cup points table read after India's defeat?
253.article_body: Following India's defeat against New Zealand in 2022 Women's World Cup, hosts New Zealand jumped to second spot with four points from three matches and a net run-rate of +0.799. India are fifth with a win and a defeat in their first two matches. Australia are on top of the standings with four points and a net run-rate of +1.061.

254.title: Destroy disease-causing pathogens from labs: WHO to Ukraine
254.article_body:
The World Health Organization (WHO) said it has advised Ukraine to destroy "high-threat pathogens to prevent any potential spills" that would spread disease among the population. Biosecurity experts
said that Russia's invasion of Ukraine has raised the risk of an escape of disease-causing pathogens. The WHO didn't provide specifics about the pathogens or toxins housed in Ukraine's laboratories.

255.title: Man in US alerts police after watching burglar entering his Hyd home on CCTV
255.article_body: A Hyderabad resident living in the US prevented a burglary attempt at his home after he noticed an intruder and alerted the police. The house owner watched the CCTV footage of a burglar breaking into his house in KPHB colony, police said. He then alerted the neighbours who noticed the lock had been broken and the house bolted from inside.

256.title: 11-year-old accident victim gives new life to 4 in Chandigarh
256.article_body: An 11-year-old girl, Nayna Thakur, who was declared brain dead by doctors at PGIMER in Chandigarh after a fatal accident, has given new lives to four people. Her family donated her organs after which her kidneys were transplanted to matching receipts. Her corneas also helped two blind people restore their eyesight. Doctors have praised Nayna's family for their brave decision.

257.title: ACP booked, 3 aides arrested for assaulting family in Punjab's Ludhiana
257.article_body: An assistant commissioner of police (ACP) has been booked and three of his aides have been arrested for allegedly assaulting a family in a bid to grab their land in Punjab's Ludhiana. ACP, who was present at the spot at the time of the assault, fled. "ACP wanted to grab 600 square-yard plot for a long time," the complainant said.

258.title: Case against private resort owners in K'taka for encroaching forest land
258.article_body: A forest offence case (FOC) has been registered against the owners of a private resort for alleged encroachment of over five-acre land of Moorkannugudda forest in Karnataka's Sakleshpur. "The proprietors concerned say that they have bought the land from the revenue department. However, no revenue officer has any authority to grant forest land," a senior forest department official said.

259.title: At least 40 COVID patients overcharged at Gurugram hospitals last year
259.article_body: At least 40 COVID-19 patients were overcharged at Gurugram hospitals during the second wave of pandemic last year with bills going up to ₹31 lakh, the district administration said. These hospitals have been asked to refund the extra amount to the patients. The administration had received 65 complaints of overcharging at private hospitals including 10 major hospitals, an official confirmed.

260.title: Russia says pic of injured pregnant woman in Ukraine attack is 'fake', calls her 'actor'
260.article_body: The Russian Embassy in UK has tweeted that a viral picture of a pregnant woman injured during the Ukraine maternity hospital attack is "fake". The embassy said that the attack on the hospital in Mariupol was staged, alleging that the pregnant victim was an "actor". Twitter deleted the tweets from the embassy, saying they were in violation of rules.

261.title: West Bengal relaxes night curfew on Holi eve for Holika Dahan celebrations
261.article_body: The West Bengal government on Thursday announced that it would lift night curfew in the state on the night of 17 March, the day before Holi, to enable the celebration of 'Holika Dahan'. Restrictions relating to the movement of people and vehicles between 12 am and 5 am shall be relaxed, the state government said in an order.

262.title: India reports 4,194 COVID-19 cases, 255 deaths in last 24 hours
262.article_body: India has reported 4,194 new COVID-19 cases and 255 deaths in the last 24 hours, according to the Ministry of Health and Family Welfare. This comes a day after the country saw 4,184 cases and 104 deaths. India's active caseload stands at 42,219, while the death toll in the country has reached 5,15,714.

263.title: First drone school inaugurated in Madhya Pradesh's Gwalior
263.article_body: Madhya Pradesh CM Shivraj Singh Chouhan and Union Civil Aviation Minister Jyotiraditya Scindia inaugurated the first "drone school" in Gwalior on Thursday. Chouhan said that this is the first of the five drone schools that have been planned in the state. He added that the use of drones will increase in the coming times and will create employment opportunities.

264.title: TikTok nears data-storage deal with Oracle for US users: Reports
264.article_body: TikTok is close to completing a deal with Oracle to store its US users' data, media reports said. Oracle had earlier discussed acquiring a minority stake in TikTok in 2020, when ByteDance faced pressure from the US government to sell the app. TikTok is also exploring partnerships with other technology companies over firewalls and cyber security measures.

265.title: Former FCI DGM, wife convicted of money laundering, get 3 years in jail
265.article_body: A Chennai court has convicted a former deputy general manager (DGM) of the Food Corporation of India (FCI), Dorai Raj and his wife, Sarumathi of money laundering, Enforcement Directorate (ED) said. The two convicts have been sentenced to three years of rigorous imprisonment. The court has also ordered for "immediate confiscation" of Sarumathi's attached property worth ₹81 lakh, ED added.

266.title: Thane petrol pump employee refuses to give man diesel in water bottle, attacked
266.article_body: A man attacked an employee of a petrol pump with a paver block on his head in Thane's Ulhasnagar after the latter refused to give diesel to him in a plastic bottle. Police are trying to trace the accused using CCTV footage. "The bottle's mouth was small. The nozzle of the petrol pump couldn't fit inside it," an officer said.

267.title: Centre giving 'stepmotherly' treatment to Maha: Awhad on Dharavi project
267.article_body: Maharashtra Minister of Housing Jitendra Awhad alleged that Centre is not paying attention to the Dharavi redevelopment plan even after the state government paid ₹800 crore for 45 acres of land. Why the Centre is giving a "stepmotherly" treatment to the state, Awhad said in the Assembly. Maharashtra government has written at least 10 letters to Centre, he further added.

268.title: 7 booked for trying to kill a 15-yr-old boy during fight in Pune
268.article_body: Pune police have booked seven persons for allegedly attempting to murder a 15-year-old boy during a fight between two groups in the Janata Vasahat slum area. The accused had reportedly attacked the victim and his friends with sickles and bamboo sticks, causing multiple injuries. The accused claimed that it was revenge for a sickle attack on the accused's friends.

269.title: Facebook allows posts seeking violence against 'Russian invaders' or Putin's death
269.article_body: Facebook parent Meta Platforms has temporarily eased rules to allow users in some countries to use violent speech like 'death to Russian invaders' in context of Ukraine's invasion, Reuters reported citing internal emails. "We still won't allow credible calls for violence against Russian civilians," a statement said. It's also allowing some posts that call for death to President Vladimir Putin.

270.title: PSG President threatens to kill Real Madrid staff member after CL defeat: Reports
270.article_body: After PSG's 2-3 aggregate loss to Real Madrid in Champions League round of 16, PSG President Nasser Al-Khelaifi went to referee's room and allegedly broke officiating equipment in anger. He also threatened to kill Real Madrid employee, who was recording the incident. Al-Khelaifi was reportedly unhappy about Karim Benzema's challenge on goalkeeper Gianluigi Donnarumma in second-half of second leg.

271.title: S Africa asked to mediate in Russia-Ukraine conflict: Prez Ramaphosa
271.article_body: South African President Cyril Ramaphosa said that "based on its relations with Russia and as a member of BRICS", South Africa has been asked to mediate in the Russia-Ukraine conflict. Ramaphosa did not reveal who made the request. However, he added he has told Russian President Vladimir Putin in a phone call that the conflict should be settled through negotiations.

272.title: Auto-rickshaw driver, his 3 aides rob Pune passenger at knifepoint, booked
272.article_body: An auto-rickshaw driver and his aides have been booked for allegedly robbing a 35-year-old passenger of his mobile phone and ₹500 at knifepoint in Pune. Police said the victim had boarded the auto-rickshaw near Khuda bridge during early morning. Three more people were present in the vehicle and the driver said that he would drop him in the Deccan area.

273.title: Top Russian commander who was awarded Order of Courage by Putin killed in Ukraine
273.article_body: A top Russian commander was killed by Ukrainian forces in an ambush on tanks that they forced into retreat outside Kyiv. Colonel Andrei Zakharov was awarded the Order of Courage by Russian President Vladimir Putin in 2016. At least five other Russian commanders have been killed since the invasion was launched two weeks ago, Ukraine has claimed.

274.title: 9 B'luru malls haven't paid ₹69 cr property tax to BBMP: K'taka CM
274.article_body: Karnataka CM Basavaraj Bommai on Thursday said that nine malls in Bengaluru haven't paid property tax worth a total of about ₹69 crore to the Bruhat Bengaluru Mahanagara Palike (BBMP). Bommai said this while replying during the Question Hour in the state Legislative Council. According to the data provided by Bommai, Mantri Mall hasn't paid ₹20.33 crore property tax.

275.title: Man uses car with Delhi Police sticker for liquor smuggling, arrested
275.article_body: A 27-year-old man was arrested for smuggling liquor using a car with a Delhi Police sticker on its windscreen. Police laid a trap to arrest the man, a resident of Najafgarh, after receiving a tip-off. Police intercepted the car in the Shalimar Bagh area and found it was loaded with 24 boxes of illicit liquor, DCP (North-West) Usha Rangnani said.

276.title: 3 town planning schemes passed for Pune's Uruli Devachi, Phursungi
276.article_body: Pune Municipal Corporation (PMC) has approved three town planning schemes' execution around the proposed Pune Metropolitan Region Development Authority ring road. The schemes will come up at Uruli Devachi and Phursungi on 650 hectares of land. PMC Leader of House Ganesh Bidkar said it's a win-win situation as PMC will get land for free and landowners will receive developed land.

277.title: World's longest car with swimming pool, helipad breaks its own Guinness record
277.article_body: The world's longest car, a super-limousine, has broken its own Guinness World Record for previously being the longest car. First built in California in 1986 by car customiser Jay Ohrberg, 'The American Dream' originally measured 60 feet. Ohrberg later extended the limo to 100 feet. It includes a large waterbed, a swimming pool, jacuzzi, bathtub, mini-golf course and a helipad.

278.title: Delhi HC directs DMRC to pay ₹6,330 cr to Reliance's Airport Express Line
278.article_body: The Delhi High Court directed the Delhi Metro Rail Corporation (DMRC) to pay ₹6,330 crore to Reliance Infrastructure's Delhi Airport Metro Express Private Limited (DAMEPL) for an arbitration award passed in 2017. It asked DMRC to divert funds or raise loans to pay the amount to DAMEPL. DMRC is required to pay the amount in three installments by May 31.

279.title: Final results of UP Assembly election out; BJP wins 255 of 403 seats
279.article_body: The Election Commission has declared the final results of Uttar Pradesh Assembly election, with BJP winning 255 of 403 assembly seats in the state. While BJP will return to power in the state, Samajwadi Party secured 111 seats. Congress won two seats, BSP won one and Apna Dal (Soneylal) won 12 seats.

280.title: BJP wins 47 of 70 seats in Uttarakhand as EC declares final results
280.article_body: BJP will form the government for the second consecutive term in Uttarakhand after securing 47 of 70 seats in the state assembly election. According to the results declared by Election Commission, Congress won 19 assembly seats and BSP won two seats. Meanwhile, Independent candidates secured win over two seats in the state.

281.title: Japan to give ₹65,000 to foreign students in financial trouble: Report
281.article_body: Japan will give 100,000 yen (over ₹65,000) to support foreign exchange students who are facing financial trouble due to COVID-19, local media reported. The cash handout is reportedly aimed to aide people studying in Japanese universities, colleges and vocational schools. The move comes after Japan eased its entry requirements for visitors, including international students, earlier this month.

282.title: Incredibly lucky to be alive after beating cancer: Stanley Tucci
282.article_body: Actor Stanley Tucci has said he feels "incredibly lucky" after successfully fighting a battle with cancer. "They [doctors] couldn't do surgery because the tumour was so big. It's a miracle that it didn't metastasize," he said. The actor underwent a 35-day radiation treatment and seven sessions of chemotherapy, which affected his senses of taste and smell.

283.title: 700g marijuana, GOGO cigarettes recovered from drug peddler in MP
283.article_body: A 24-year-old drug peddler was arrested in Madhya Pradesh's Rajpur following a tip-off and 700 grams of marijuana and marijuana-filled GOGO cigarettes were recovered from him, police said. During interrogation, the peddler revealed he sold the 20 grams drug packets for ₹200 and GOGO cigarettes for ₹100. A case under the Narcotic Drugs and Psychotropic Substances Act has been registered.

284.title: Canada's Ontario to lift mandatory mask rule on March 21
284.article_body: Canada's Ontario is set to lift its mandatory mask rule for most settings, including schools, from March 21 onwards, officials announced on Wednesday. "We're now learning to live with...COVID-19 for the long term...This necessitates a shift to a more balanced response," Ontario Chief Medical Officer of Health Dr Kieran Moore said. Ontario reported 2,125 COVID-19 cases on Thursday.

285.title: PMC beautifies 7,000 sq feet underutilised plot at Prem Nagar slums
285.article_body: The Pune Municipal Corporation (PMC) has transformed a 7,000 square feet street space into a public space at Prem Nagar slums. A member of the initiative said that the space had been underutilised before and mostly used for parking. "The initiative saw the light of the day with the support of MLA Sunil Kamble and PMC officials," he added.

286.title: Our needs are linked to both nations: PM on India's neutrality on Russia-Ukraine
286.article_body: Talking about the Russia-Ukraine war and India's neutral stance on the conflict, PM Narendra Modi on Thursday said, "India's several needs are connected to these countries." He said that India has economic, security-related, education-related and political links with both Russia and Ukraine. India had earlier abstained from voting on a UNGA resolution against the Russian invasion of Ukraine.

287.title: No fast track exists for Ukraine's EU membership: Dutch PM
287.article_body: Speaking about Ukraine's application to join the European Union, Dutch Prime Minister Mark Rutte said on Thursday that there is no fast track procedure to become a member of the EU. Ukraine had applied for EU membership shortly after the Russian invasion. Rutte made the comment as he arrived at an EU summit at the Versailles Palace in France.

288.title: 100% crowd to be allowed for India-Sri Lanka Day-Night Test in Bengaluru
288.article_body: The M Chinnaswamy Stadium in Bengaluru will be allowed to have a 100% capacity crowd for the second India-Sri Lanka Test, confirmed Karnataka State Cricket Association (KSCA). Earlier, only 50% of the crowd was allowed due to COVID related restrictions. The second Test, beginning Saturday, will be a Day-Night Test. India lead the two-match series 1-0.

289.title: Man jailed for 8 yrs, fined ₹25,000 for sexually assaulting 13-yr-old
289.article_body: A man has been sentenced to eight years in jail for committing a sexual assault on a 13-year-old intellectually disabled girl in Mumbai in 2016. The accused who was aged 25 at the time had taken advantage of her, the special judge observed while refusing to show leniency in the matter. A ₹25,000 fine has also been imposed on him.

290.title: India is on the side of peace: PM Modi on Russia-Ukraine crisis
290.article_body: While giving a speech to party workers at BJP headquarters, PM Narendra Modi spoke about ongoing Russia-Ukraine conflict. "The ongoing war is affecting every country across the world. India is on side of peace and hopes that all problems are resolved with deliberations," he stated. PM Modi further said India's several needs are connected to the countries involved in war.

291.title: Nadal's start to 2022 season reminds me of Federer in 2017: Haas
291.article_body: Indian Wells tournament director Tommy Haas has said Rafael Nadal's 15-0 start to the 2022 season reminds him of Roger Federer's 2017 start (19-1), when the 20-time Grand Slam made a comeback from a knee surgery after six months. Nadal, who came back from a foot injury, has won Melbourne Summer Set, Australian Open and Mexican Open titles so far.

292.title: Let the American broomstick fly: SpaceX director on launch of Starlink satellites
292.article_body: SpaceX's launch director took a dig at Russian space agency's chief Dmitry Rogozin's recent remark during launch of Starlink satellites. "Time to let the American broomstick fly and hear the sounds of freedom," the director said as the rocket prepared to take off. Rogozin earlier said Americans could "fly on their broomsticks" after Russia stopped selling rocket engines to US.

293.title: 21-yr-old man found dead in open ground in Thane, probe launched
293.article_body: Police have launched a murder investigation after a 21-year-old jeans manufacturing unit worker was found dead in an open ground in Maharashtra's Thane last month. A post-mortem report has allegedly revealed that the victim, Sandeep Divakar, died due to strangulation. "We interrogated his brother and others to get details about...past rivalries...We're investigating from all angles," police said.

294.title: 2 held for their role in e-financial fraud on apps in Mumbai
294.article_body: The cyber-cell unit of Mira Bhayandar-Vasai Virar (MBVV) police has arrested two people, including a 50-year-old woman, for their alleged role in e-financial fraud on apps. This comes as a 26-year-old woman filed a complaint after availing instant loans amounting to ₹2.4 lakh by downloading such applications. A case under relevant sections of IPC and Information Technology Act was registered.

295.title: Don't know what to tell him, how to react: Ashwin on Rohit calling him 'all-time great'
295.article_body: Reacting to India captain Rohit Sharma terming him an "all-time great", Ravichandran Ashwin said, "I don't know what to tell Rohit. I am very bad at receiving compliments. I don't really know how to react." "Rohit went out into the press conference and lavished praise on me...At the breakfast hall I said that was very sweet of him," he added.

296.title: I think 'mankad' dismissal is unfair, I wouldn't consider it: Broad on rule change
296.article_body: After MCC removed 'mankading' dismissal from 'unfair play' section to 'run-out' section in rule book, England pacer Stuart Broad said, "Hasn't it always been a legitimate dismissal & whether it is unfair is subjective?" He added, "I think it's unfair & wouldn't consider it, as [in my opinion] dismissing a batter is about skill & the Mankad requires zero skill."

297.title: I congratulate AAP for Punjab win, I assure all possible support: PM Modi
297.article_body: After AAP won 92 of 117 seats in Punjab Assembly election, PM Narendra Modi tweeted, "I would like to congratulate AAP for their victory in the Punjab elections. I assure all possible support from the Centre for Punjab's welfare." AAP's CM candidate Bhagwant Mann said he'll take the oath of office in freedom fighter Bhagat Singh's ancestral village Khatkar Kalan.

298.title: Fish species bearing bright pink colour found in coral reefs of Maldives
298.article_body: A new fish species bearing bright pink colour has been found living in the deep reefs of the Maldives and Sri Lanka. The species have been named 'Cirrhilabrus finifenmaa', one of the first species to be named in Dhivehi, the language spoken in the Maldives. 'Finifenmaa' name was chosen because of its vibrant pink hue resembling a pink rose.

299.title: Must work closely with Bosnia to include it in EU: German minister
299.article_body: German Foreign Minister Annalena Baerbock on Thursday said Germany and Bosnia-Herzegovina must work closely to include the Balkan nation in European Union (EU) amid Russia-Ukraine war. During a joint news conference with her Bosnian counterpart, Bisera Turković, Baerbock added that the Ukraine conflict was proof that more reconciliation between the Western Balkans and the EU was needed.

300.title: Japan Tobacco, the largest cigarette maker in Russia, suspends Russia investments
300.article_body:
Japan Tobacco Inc (JTI), the largest cigarette producer in Russia, has suspended all new investments and marketing activities in Russia effectively immediately following the Russian invasion of Ukraine. "The challenges of operating in Russia at this time
are unprecedented," the company said. JTI added it "cannot exclude the possibility of a
suspension of manufacturing operations in Russia".

301.title: India's cumulative COVID vaccination coverage nears 180 cr-mark
301.article_body: The Union Health Ministry on Thursday said that the cumulative number of doses of COVID-19 vaccines administered in India rose to over 179.69 crore. More than 14 lakh doses of coronavirus vaccines were administered till 7 pm today, it added. Over 2.10 crore booster doses of COVID-19 vaccines have been administered so far, it further said.

302.title: Want a game where you can create 20 chances: Warner after Rawalpindi Test
302.article_body: Talking about the pitch condition in the drawn first Pakistan-Australia Test in Rawalpindi, Australia opener David Warner said, "There wasn't any variable bounce, which you generally do see on worn wickets." He added, "I just want a game where you can actually create 20 chances. It's something that's going to be exciting and entertaining for the crowd."

303.title: Confident, aggressive Vastrakar is being seen in 2022 WC: Krishnamurthy
303.article_body: India Women cricketer Veda Krishnamurthy said a different Pooja Vastrakar is being seen in ongoing 2022 Women's World Cup. "A confident, aggressive, experienced Vastrakar...it was not only her death bowling but initially also when she came to bowl [against New Zealand], she looked very effective," she added. The India pacer registered bowling figures of 10-0-34-4 against New Zealand on Thursday.

304.title: B'luru minority college allows students in hijab to attend class
304.article_body: Mount Carmel College in Bengaluru has allowed pre-university students to attend class wearing the hijab along with uniform. This comes after the state government clarified to the Karnataka High Court that restrictions on religious attire won't apply to private, minority-run institutions. "We can comfortably wear hijabs now...teachers...pre-university department had no objections," a student said.

305.title: Final results of Manipur election out, BJP wins 32 of 60 seats
305.article_body: The BJP won 32 out of 60 Assembly seats in Manipur while five seats were won by Congress, the final tally from Election Commission revealed on Thursday. The National People's Party, JD(U) and Naga People's Front won seven, six and five seats respectively. Two seats were won by the Kuki People's Alliance while independent candidates emerged victorious on three seats.

306.title: Food prices will rise globally: Putin on western sanctions on Russia amid war
306.article_body: Russian President Vladimir Putin has said that western sanctions on Russia due to the Ukraine war could lead to an increase in global food prices. "Russia and Belarus are some of the biggest suppliers of mineral fertilisers. If they continue to create problems for...delivery of our goods, then prices will rise and this will affect the final...food products," said Putin.

307.title: Blinkit raises $100 million from Zomato: Report
307.article_body: Quick commerce startup Blinkit, formerly known as Grofers, has raised $100 million in a new funding round, ET Now reported citing CEO Albinder Dhindsa's email to employees. The funds are being raised from Zomato and are part of a larger $400-million round, ET reported separately. Zomato invested $100 million in Blinkit and its wholesale entity Hands on Trades last year.

308.title: We wanted to take it as deep as we could: Amy on NZ's win vs India in WC
308.article_body: New Zealand batter Amy Satterthwaite, who was adjudged 'Player of the Match' against India in 2022 Women's World Cup, said her side wanted to take the match as deep as they could. "Was an interesting one, certainly patches where I really struggled," she stated. Satterthwaite scored 84-ball 75 in team's 62-run win. India were all-out for 198 in 46.4 overs.

309.title: My mother has a 'never say die' spirit: Masaba on Neena Gupta
309.article_body: Fashion designer Masaba Gupta has said her mother and actress Neena Gupta is a "survivor". "I think she has a 'never say die' spirit. She's someone who's 67 years old...and she's just about starting again," Masaba said. "You should never give up and never say die. I think that's the one thing I've learned from her," Masaba added.

310.title: Let people breathe: Varun on fans' requests to patch up with Divya
310.article_body: Reacting to requests to get back together with Divya Agarwal, VJ Varun Sood on Thursday requested his fans to give him some space. "Let people breathe...Quit the blame game," he wrote on Twitter. Meanwhile, Divya said, "You know what hurts the most? People want to see me somewhere and I don't want to be there...So stop trying."

311.title: Fake ITC racket worth ₹32 crore busted in Maha, businessman held
311.article_body: A fake Input Tax Credit (ITC) racket worth ₹32.5 crore was busted by officers of Bhiwandi Commissionerate of CGST Mumbai Zone. A businessman involved was arrested after it was found that he opened two firms in his name and didn't produce documents on which ITC is claimed and passed on. This is Bhiwandi Commissionerate's seventh arrest in last six months.

312.title: Grimes explains meaning of 'Exa Dark Sideræl', name of her and Elon Musk's 2nd child
312.article_body: Grimes explained the meaning of 'Exa Dark Sideræl', name of her and Tesla CEO Elon Musk's second child. Exa refers to supercomputing term exaFLOPS while Dark is "the unknown". "People fear it but truly it's...absence of photons," she said. Grimes further called Sideræl "a more elven" spelling of sidereal, "the true time of...universe, star time...not our relative earth time".

313.title: Mother of Indian envoy who was found dead in Palestine disputes cause of death
313.article_body: The mother of Indian envoy Mukul Arya, who was found dead in Palestine on March 6, approached the Delhi HC seeking an inquiry into the "suspicious circumstances" of his death, disputing the Centre's claim that he died of natural causes. Court has ordered a fresh autopsy for Arya and said that the same should be videographed.

314.title: OTT content transcends cultures, languages: Arjan Bajwa
314.article_body: Actor Arjan Bajwa has said the OTT platforms are a "complete game changer". "The big advantage of OTT is that you can watch stuff which is spread across languages, continents and cultures," he said. "Just like cinema stayed alongside home videos or satellite television, OTT will sustain. But OTT gives you more of an edge," he added.

315.title: Congress lost by a very small margin in Goa: P Chidambaram
315.article_body: Congress leader P Chidambaram on Thursday said that the party lost in Goa by a very small margin. "We accept the verdict of the people of Goa. Our candidates fought bravely, despite several obstacles. People have voted BJP to power and we accept that," he further said. BJP has emerged as the single largest party with 20 seats in Goa.

316.title: S Korea's President-elect vows tougher stance against N Korea
316.article_body: South Korean President-elect Yoon Suk-yeol on Thursday said that he will take a tougher stance against North Korean provocations. Yoon also said that he will solidify an alliance with the US and build a powerful military. He also stressed a need to recognise the strategic importance of repairing ties with Japan despite a dispute over wartime history.

317.title: AAP won in Punjab due to impact of farmers' agitation in Delhi: Pawar
317.article_body: While reacting to Aam Aadmi Party crossing the majority mark in Punjab, The Nationalist Congress Party President Sharad Pawar said that most of the farmers were in Delhi during the farmers' agitation and that its impact on the polls was visible. He further said, "Punjab accepted AAP only because of the amenities provided in Delhi."

318.title: Congress unable to convert hard work into votes in UP: Priyanka
318.article_body: As BJP is set to form its government in Uttar Pradesh, Congress leader Priyanka Gandhi said the party was unable to "convert our hard work into votes" in the state. Priyanka said, "[Vote] of...people is paramount in a democracy...We'll continue to fulfil the duty of...strong opposition." Congress has won two seats in UP, while BJP won 232 seats so far.

319.title: Man strangles wife to death suspecting infidelity in Bengaluru
319.article_body: A 38-year-old man, suspecting infidelity, allegedly strangled his wife (37) to death in the presence of their eight-year-old daughter in Bengaluru on the intervening night of Monday and Tuesday, according to reports. The accused went into hiding but was caught on Wednesday, with the help of technical intelligence and informants. The accused, identified as Neelakantha, was a cab driver.

320.title: He doesn't have 'damkham' to learn from mistakes: Irani on Rahul
320.article_body: Responding to Rahul Gandhi's "learn from mistakes tweet," Union Minister Smriti Irani said, "I don't think he has the 'damkham' (strength) to learn from his mistakes." She further said, "In Uttar Pradesh, it was said that Priyanka will infuse new life into the party, instead she destroyed it." Irani accused Samajwadi Party of "maligning" the name of the Election Commission.

321.title: Hotel receptionist arrested for raping 20-yr-old woman in Gurugram
321.article_body: A hotel receptionist in Gurugram's Bhondsi was arrested for allegedly raping a 20-year-old multiple times after promising to marry her, police said on Thursday. The woman in her complaint alleged that the accused used to take her to the staff room of the hotel and get physical. She added that she's one-month pregnant, but he has refused to marry her.

322.title: Russian bombardment in Ukraine is barbaric: Polish President
322.article_body: Polish President Andrzej Duda on Thursday said bombing of hospitals and housing estates in Ukraine by the Russian forces is barbaric. "There are pregnant women, there are children... you throw bombs, rockets at housing estates, this is barbarism bearing the features of genocide." President Duda's remarks came a day after Russian forces attacked a maternity hospital in Ukraine's Mariupol.

323.title: UP Deputy CM KP Maurya loses from Sirathu by over 7,000 votes
323.article_body: Uttar Pradesh Deputy CM and BJP leader Keshav Prasad Maurya lost from the Sirathu Assembly seat on Thursday by 7,337 votes. Samajwadi Party's Dr Pallavi Patel won from the constituency by securing over one lakh votes. Earlier, SP alleged that BJP workers were prohibiting Patel from taking her winning certificate by pelting stones at the counting centre.

324.title: Musk, Grimes secretly welcomed 2nd baby via surrogacy; named her Exa Dark Sideræl
324.article_body: Singer-songwriter Grimes revealed to Vanity Fair that she secretly welcomed a girl with world's richest man and Tesla CEO Elon Musk in December via surrogacy. Grimes, who's also the mother to a son with Musk, shared that the baby's name is Exa Dark Sideræl and they've nicknamed her Y. Their son, who's named X AE A-XII, was born in 2020.

325.title: There should be probe into Russia's conduct in war, says US VP
325.article_body: Speaking on calls for an international war crimes investigation of Russia over its invasion of Ukraine, US Vice President Kamala Harris said, "Absolutely there should be an investigation, and we should all be watching." "I have no question the eyes of...world are on this war and what Russia has done in terms of this aggression and these atrocities," she added.

326.title: Indian Railways resumes providing linen, blankets inside trains
326.article_body: The Indian Railways announced on Thursday that they are resuming the services of providing linen, blankets and curtains inside trains, after nearly two years. In an order issued to general managers of all railway zones, the Railway Board said the supply would resume with immediate effect. The items had been discontinued as a precautionary measure against the COVID-19 pandemic.

327.title: US inflation increases 7.9% YoY in February, biggest rise in 40 years
327.article_body: Retail inflation in the US rose 7.9%, the biggest YoY rise since January 1982, the US Labor Department reported on Thursday. Monthly rise in US inflation has stayed above the 0.6% mark since October 2021, marking a 0.6% increase in both December 2021 and January 2022 and a 0.8% rise in February. Food Price Index marked a 7.9% YoY increase.

328.title: Change is unavoidable if we want success: Shashi Tharoor on results
328.article_body: Congress MP from Thiruvananthapuram Shashi Tharoor commented on Congress' poor performance in five Assembly polls and said, "Change is unavoidable if we need to succeed." "It is time to...reform our organisational leadership in a manner that will...inspire the people," he tweeted. He said all those who believe in Congress are hurt after the results.

329.title: I must have refused around 100 cop films: Ajay Devgn
329.article_body: Actor Ajay Devgn in an interview has revealed that he must have refused around 100 cop films. The actor further said that all the cops that he has portrayed have been different from each other. "The cop in 'Gangaajal'...was sober, in control and believed in anti-violence. 'Singham' is Singham....'Rudra'...is a thinking cop with a criminal mind," Ajay said.

330.title: BJP will come back to power in Karnataka in 2023: CM Bommai
330.article_body: Karnataka Chief Minister Basavaraj Bommai on Thursday said that he's confident that BJP will come back to power in the state after the state Assembly elections next year. "We will build a strong and prosperous Karnataka by implementing the good programmes already announced in the recent budget," he said. BJP is set to form the government in four states.

331.title: Final results of Goa election declared, BJP wins 20 of 40 seats
331.article_body: According to the final result released by EC for Goa Assembly polls, BJP won 20 seats while Congress won 11 seats. The Aam Aadmi Party and the Maharashtrawadi Gomantak Party won two seats each while the Goa Forward Party won a single seat. The Revolutionary Goans Party also won from one seat while three seats were won by independent candidates.

332.title: BJP's Sunil Kumar Sharma wins from UP's Sahibabad by 2.14 lakh votes
332.article_body: BJP's Sunil Kumar Sharma on Thursday won from the Sahibabad seat in Uttar Pradesh by 2,14,835 votes. His nearest rival was Amarpal Sharma of the Samajwadi Party who received 1,07,759 votes while BSP's Ajit Kumar Pal got 24,021 votes. Notably, BJP has secured the required majority mark of 202 seats in the Uttar Pradesh Assembly elections.

333.title: 1st time voters have ensured BJP's victory in 4 states: PM Modi
333.article_body: PM Narendra Modi on Thursday thanked first-time voters for ensuring BJP's victories in four out of five states that went to polls in February and March. PM Modi added that all exit polls were proven incorrect in Goa and that the party has made history in Uttarakhand by coming to power in the state for the second consecutive term.

334.title: I lost election, not my courage: SP leader Swami Maurya on UP defeat
334.article_body: Ex-UP minister and Samajwadi Party (SP) leader Swami Prasad Maurya conceded his defeat in state Assembly polls, stating that he had lost election but not courage. "I respect people's mandate. I congratulate all winning candidates," he added. Maurya, who lost to BJP's Surendra Kumar Kushwaha by a margin of over 45,000 votes, had left BJP to join SP before polls.

335.title: People were frustrated: AAP's Jeevan Jyot Kaur who defeated Sidhu, Majithia
335.article_body: Aam Aadmi Party (AAP) candidate Jeevan Jyot Kaur, who defeated Congress' Navjot Singh Sidhu and Shiromani Akali Dal's (SAD) Bikram Singh Majithia from Amritsar East Assembly seat, said that Punjab has overcome identity politics. She added people were "frustrated with other political parties" and felt "looted". She further said AAP isn't here to do politics but "to change the politics".

336.title: BJP is forming govt with 'Jai Shree Ram' on March 10: Aparna Yadav
336.article_body: BJP leader Aparna Yadav, who's the daughter-in-law of Mulayam Singh Yadav, said that UP can't get a better government than BJP. Reflecting on their current lead in the state, she said this is an answer to those who divided the state on basis of appeasement politics and caste, adding, BJP is forming "government with 'Jai Shree Ram' on March 10".

337.title: Belarus President to meet Putin on Friday: Kremlin
337.article_body: Kremlin spokesperson Dmitry Peskov on Thursday said Belarusian President Alexander Lukashenko and Russian President Vladimir Putin will meet on Friday. Peskov added Lukashenko will pay a working visit to Moscow on Friday and hold talks with President Putin. This comes as Lukashenko reportedly instructed his defence ministry that Belarusian army must prevent any attack on Russians from the rear.

338.title: Our army must prevent attack on Russians from the rear: Belarus Prez
338.article_body: Belarusian President Alexander Lukashenko on Thursday told his defence ministry that Belarusian army must prevent any attack on Russian forces from the rear, reported state news agency BelTA. He added army must prevent any attempt presumably by Ukraine to cut off Russian supply lines. Earlier today, media said that Lukashenko and Russian President Vladimir Putin plan to discuss allied cooperation.

339.title: Final results of Punjab election declared, AAP wins 92 of 117 seats
339.article_body: The Election Commission has declared the final results of the Punjab Assembly elections, with AAP emerging as a winner with 92 of 117 assembly seats. The ruling Congress party managed to gain victory over 18	 seats, while SAD won three seats and BJP two. BSP won one seat and an Independent candidate also secured one seat.

340.title: If B'wood doesn't get stars, it hires people who were once stars: Sudhir
340.article_body: Filmmaker Sudhir Mishra has stated that Bollywood is still star-driven, adding that if they don't get stars, they concoct the idea of a star by hiring people who were once stars. The filmmaker further said that the focus should be on talent, skill and script rather than just the name of the person starring in a film.

341.title: Putin may have Parkinson's disease & uses steroids: Former UK spy chief
341.article_body: The former head of UK's Secret Intelligence Service, or MI6, Sir Richard Dearlove has said that there are speculations that Russian President Vladimir Putin may have Parkinson's disease, which could cause symptoms such as 'loss of restrain'. "And then there's visual evidence he may be on steroids because of the way his appearance has changed," Dearlove added amid Ukraine-Russia war.

342.title: Congress MLAs stage walkout from MP Assembly over cattle deaths
342.article_body: Congress MLAs on Thursday staged a walkout from the Madhya Pradesh state assembly over the issue of cattle deaths. Supporting the demand of BJP MLA Subedar Singh for compensation to the affected families, Congress alleged that the state government was not considering the problems seriously. They also claimed that the state government only used cows for its political benefits.

343.title: A day will come when sun will set on dynastic politics: PM Modi
343.article_body: Addressing BJP workers at the party's headquarters in Delhi on Thursday, PM Narendra Modi said that a day will come when the sun will set on dynastic politics in the country. People indicated this in these state polls as well, he added. BJP is set to form state governments in Manipur, Goa, Uttarakhand and Uttar Pradesh.

344.title: BJP crosses majority mark, becomes 1st ruling party to return to power in UP in 37 years
344.article_body: BJP has secured required majority mark of 202 seats in Uttar Pradesh Assembly elections and will form the government in the state for the second straight time. With this, BJP has become the first ruling party to return to power in Uttar Pradesh in 37 years. Meanwhile, Samajwadi Party has won 75 seats in the Assembly elections so far.

345.title: BJP wins 31 of 60 Manipur seats, set to retain power in the state
345.article_body: BJP on Thursday won 31 out of the total 60 Assembly seats in Manipur, making it clear that it will retain power in the northeastern state. Earlier while thanking the voters, CM N Biren Singh said, "We assure you that this time we would double our effort." He claimed he would urge the Centre to remove AFSPA from Manipur.

346.title: Don't believe one-sided story: Kapil on allegation of not inviting 'The Kashmir...' team
