346.article_body: Kapil Sharma has responded to claims that The Kapil Sharma Show makers refused to get the team of Vivek Agnihotri's 'The Kashmir Files' on the show as the film doesn't have a "big commercial star". Replying to a Twitter user, Kapil wrote, "This is not the truth...Just a suggestion- never believe in one sided story in today's social media world."

347.title: We'll do better next time: Owaisi as AIMIM fails to secure a seat in UP
347.article_body: After AIMIM failed to secure a seat in Uttar Pradesh, the party's chief Asaduddin Owaisi said, "UP public has decided to give power to BJP, I respect [their decision]." He said, "Our efforts were quite a lot, but the results didn't come as per our expectations." "We'll start working again from tomorrow...I believe we'll do better next time," he added.

348.title: Amit Shah expresses gratitude to voters in 4 states for electing BJP
348.article_body: After trends suggested that BJP will form governments in Goa, Manipur, Uttar Pradesh and Uttarakhand, Union Home Minister Amit Shah expressed his gratitude to voters in these states for voting for the BJP. Shah credited PM Narendra Modi's leadership for the poll results. He congratulated BJP workers in these states for the results.

349.title: I was shocked: 72-yr-old Vera Wang on her pic going viral for being 'age-defying'
349.article_body:
America's 72-year-old fashion designer Vera Wang, best known for designing wedding dresses, spoke to BBC about her COVID-19 lockdown picture going viral for being "age-defying". She said, "I was really shocked. I've to be very honest. I didn't think of myself as being particularly 
risqué." She added, "I've been asked - what are my secrets?...One of them is sleep."

350.title: Mika Singh to find wife on reality show 'Swayamvar – Mika Di Vohti'
350.article_body: Singer Mika Singh will be a part of reality television show 'Swayamvar – Mika Di Vohti' in which he will find his life partner. Mika said, "I want my life to be like a duet because life is enjoyable only with your loved ones." Earlier, Rakhi Sawant, Rahul Mahajan and Ratan Rajpoot have been a part of 'Swayamvar'.

351.title: Man kills teen for bumping into him while walking in Maha, held
351.article_body: A 24-year-old man was arrested for allegedly killing an 18-year-old pedestrian because he bumped into him while walking on a road in Maharashtra's Thane. The incident reportedly took place in Bhiwandi on Monday as the accused assaulted the teenager with a stone. A passerby found the deceased's body after noticing a foul smell emanating from rubbish heaps in the area.

352.title: Will launch many satellites to monitor US troops' actions against us: North Korea
352.article_body: North Korea has said that it will launch "a lot" of satellites in the coming years to provide real-time information on military actions against it by the US and American allies. It said it will gather information on actions "by the aggression troops of the US imperialism and its vassal forces in South Korea, Japan and the Pacific".

353.title: Lithuania bans pro-Russia events as part of state of emergency
353.article_body: Lithuania has prohibited events deemed pro-Russia, Belarus as part of state of emergency measures, which were imposed following Russian invasion of Ukraine. According to new legislation, which will be in effect till April 20, rallies aimed to spread war propaganda will be banned. Additionally, media outlets can be banned for up to 72 hours if they spread "disinformation", parliament said.

354.title: I don't believe it: Russia's Foreign Minister on possibility of nuclear war
354.article_body: Russia's Foreign Minister Sergey Lavrov, when asked about whether the conflict in Ukraine would spiral into a nuclear war, said, "I don't want to believe it, and I don't believe it." He said the topic had been mentioned only by the West. He added that the West kept on returning to the topic like Sigmund Freud, the father of psychoanalysis.

355.title: Australia to expand active defence force by around 30% by 2040: Govt
355.article_body: Australian PM Scott Morrison on Thursday said government will expand country's active defence personnel by around 30% by 2040. Calling it the nation's largest peacetime military buildup, Morrison said the expansion will cost about $28 billion. Meanwhile, Defence Minister Peter Dutton said the move is critical to position Australia as a "credible partner" with the US, UK and NATO.

356.title: Experts will say results of 2022 polls decided fate of 2024 national election: PM Modi
356.article_body: While addressing the people at BJP Headquarters in Delhi after BJP's victory in four state assembly elections, PM Modi said that after the 2019 General Election, some political experts had said that the 2017 poll results had decided the 2019 outcome. "I think they will say that the 2022 poll verdict decided the outcome of 2024 elections," he added.

357.title: Will implement Uniform Civil Code in U'khand: Dhami after results
357.article_body: As the results showed a lead for the BJP in Uttarakhand, Chief Minister Pushkar Singh Dhami on Thursday said he will fulfil the promise of implementing the Uniform Civil Code in the state. "We will form a high-level committee of stakeholders after the swearing-in ceremony," he said. "The committee will prepare a draft which we will implement," he added.

358.title: Saina Nehwal crashes out of German Open, loses in 2nd round
358.article_body: Ex-world number one Saina Nehwal crashed out of the 2022 German Open after losing in the women's singles second round on Thursday. Former world champion Ratchanok Intanon defeated the unseeded Indian shuttler 21-10, 21-15 in 31 minutes at Westenergie Sporthalle in Mülheim an der Ruhr. Earlier in the day, 2019 world champion PV Sindhu also lost in the second round.

359.title: Get fishermen held in Indonesia, Seychelles freed: Stalin to MEA
359.article_body: Tamil Nadu Chief Minister MK Stalin on Thursday wrote to External Affairs Minister S Jaishankar, urging him to intervene with the authorities in Indonesia and Seychelles after a few Indian fishermen were arrested there. "I request your personal intervention...so as to secure the immediate release of the fishermen and their fishing boats," Stalin said.

360.title: BJP workers kept their promise of early Holi from March 10: PM Modi
360.article_body: PM Narendra Modi on Thursday said BJP workers had said Holi will begin early from March 10 this year and they kept their promise. He was addressing BJP workers at the party's headquarters in Delhi after trends suggested that BJP will form governments in Goa, Manipur, Uttar Pradesh and Uttarakhand. "It's a 'victory four' by our NDA workers," he added.

361.title: India likely to grow at 7.8% in FY23 with downside risks: CRISIL
361.article_body: Indian economy is likely to grow at 7.8% in FY23, driven by the government's infrastructure spending push and likely increase in private capital expenditure, a CRISIL report said. It added that the Russia-Ukraine war and rising inflation pose a downside risk to the growth. Higher oil prices will widen India's current account deficit to 2.2% in FY23, the report added.

362.title: Feels as great as always: Farhan on life post marriage with Shibani
362.article_body: Actor-filmmaker Farhan Akhtar, on being asked about how life is after marriage with actress Shibani Dandekar, said that it feels great as always. He further said that he doesn't know if it feels different but the marriage puts an official tag on their relationship. "Our relationship is amazing. It has been since we started dating," Farhan added.

363.title: Man held for raping 6-yr-old multiple times over days in Mumbai
363.article_body: A 25-year-old man was arrested for allegedly raping a six-year-old girl multiple times over five days after luring her with chocolate in Mumbai. The accused, said to be the minor's neighbour and known to her family, sexually assaulted her after taking her to his house. Police said the girl’s mother lodged an FIR after she told her about the incident.

364.title: Satellite pics from before & after Russian invasion show power cuts in Ukraine
364.article_body: Satellite pictures of Ukraine captured by NASA on February 3 (before the Russian invasion) and on March 9 (two weeks after the invasion started) have indicated widespread power cuts in the country. Ukraine's Ministry of Defence had on Monday said that Irpin, outside Kyiv, has "reportedly been without heat, water or electricity for several days." Mariupol is also without electricity.

365.title: Germany logs record over 2.6 lakh new COVID-19 cases in last 24 hours
365.article_body: Germany on Thursday reported 2,62,752 new COVID-19 cases in last 24 hours, logging the highest single-day tally since the pandemic began. As per German public health agency, 259 deaths were recorded in the same period. The surge comes as government has agreed to impose new COVID-19 restrictions to replace the existing ones which are mandated to end on March 19.

366.title: Rare zebra without black stripes spotted in Tanzania; pic goes viral
366.article_body: A rare albino zebra has been spotted in Serengeti National Park in Tanzania. Without the black and white stripes, the foal named Ndasiata is seen roaming around in a field with another zebra in a video shared by the park on Instagram. Faint grey stripes can be spotted on the foal's neck and head.

367.title: Goldman Sachs becomes the first major US bank to exit Russia
367.article_body: Goldman Sachs on Thursday said it was closing its operations in Russia, becoming the first major US bank to exit the country following Russia's invasion of Ukraine. "Goldman Sachs is winding down its business in Russia in compliance with regulatory and licensing requirements," the bank said. In its annual filing earlier, the bank disclosed a $650-million credit exposure to Russia.

368.title: Poland offers free train tickets to Ukrainians heading to Germany
368.article_body: Poland on Thursday said that it is offering free train tickets to Ukrainians travelling to Germany. Many refugees are camping in Polish train stations, hoping to travel on to other European Union (EU) countries, Polish Deputy Foreign Minister Paweł Szefernaker said. "We are working with our EU partners to facilitate this," he added.

369.title: He is on the right path: Bhagwant Mann's mother on AAP's win in Punjab
369.article_body: After AAP's victory in Punjab, the party's CM candidate Bhagwant Mann's mother Harpal Kaur expressed her happiness. She said, "I'm very happy...His father must have been happy too, to see his son becoming a Chief Minister...Earlier also, he was on the right path [and] today also, he's on the right path." Bhagwant Mann has won from the Dhuri seat.

370.title: Top-order needs to fire up: Mithali on India's 62-run loss vs NZ in WC
370.article_body: India captain Mithali Raj said the team's "top-order needs to fire" in upcoming matches in the ongoing 2022 Women's World Cup following their 62-run defeat against New Zealand. "We need to do better with the bat...it [target] was chaseable but we were losing wickets...keeping the run-rate low enough was tough," she added. It was India's first loss of the tournament.

371.title: Oldest known ancestor of octopuses had 10 limbs: Study
371.article_body: Palaeontologists on Tuesday said the oldest known ancestor of octopuses which lived nearly 330 million years ago had 10 limbs with two of them twice as long as the other eight. Named Syllipsimopodi bideni after US President Joe Biden, the animal was 12 centimetres long and had two parallel rows of suckers up and down each arm.

372.title: Pakistani intruder shot dead by BSF in Punjab's Amritsar
372.article_body: A Pakistani intruder was shot dead by the BSF in Punjab's Amritsar sector, an official statement released on Thursday said. "BSF troops observed some suspicious movement...ahead of border fencing," it said. "Troops challenged the intruder, but he did not stop and continued moving ahead...the troops fired upon the intruder in self-defence," BSF's Punjab Frontier PRO said.

373.title: Results show appeasement politics has no place in country: MP CM
373.article_body: MP Chief Minister Shivraj Singh Chouhan on Thursday said favourable results for BJP in state elections have given a message that politics of appeasement has no place in country. "It reflects the faith and confidence that people reposed in the leadership of Prime Minister Narendra Modi," he said. These polls have also risen above dynastic and caste politics, he added.

374.title: Manipur CM dances with party leaders as trends suggest BJP's win
374.article_body: Manipur CM N Biren Singh was seen dancing with other party leaders at the BJP office in Imphal, a video of which has surfaced. Singh won from the Heingang Assembly seat by defeating Congress' Pangeijam Saratchandra Singh by over 18,000 votes. As per the latest EC data, BJP won 26 seats and took a lead on five Assembly seats.

375.title: Russia is committing war crimes in Ukraine: Slovenian PM
375.article_body: Russia is committing war crimes in Ukraine, Slovenian PM Janez Janša said on Thursday, adding that Russia's military offensive is "against all conventions". Janša's remarks came as Ukrainian authorities claimed on Wednesday that a Russian aircraft bombed a children's hospital in Mariupol, despite declaring a ceasefire for civilians to flee. Russia has called the claim "fake news".

376.title: Mummification in Europe could be older than previously known: Study
376.article_body: Researchers found mummies dating back 8,000 years ago in Portugal's Sado Valley suggesting that mummification in Europe could be older than previously known. During the study of burials, team found an absence of disarticulation in parts of skeleton and an infilling of sediment around bones, both signs of mummification. Mummification is preservation of body after death by deliberately drying flesh.

377.title: Congress candidate Sidhu Moose Wala loses in Punjab election by over 63,000 votes
377.article_body: Singer and Congress candidate Sidhu Moose Wala aka Shubhdeep Singh Sidhu lost to AAP's Vijay Singla from Mansa seat in Punjab Assembly election. He lost by a margin of over 63,000 votes, according to Election Commission. Meanwhile, AAP is forming the government in Punjab after attaining victory in 92 of 117 assembly seats in the state.

378.title: Pic shows dead bodies being buried in mass grave in Ukrainian city
378.article_body: Photos from besieged Ukrainian city Mariupol show corpses being buried in a mass grave site. Authorities have ordered workers to dig 25 metre-long trenches as morgues are at breaking point. Forty bodies were dumped in the trench in the cemetery on Tuesday, followed by 30 more on Wednesday. They were said to be both civilians and soldiers.

379.title: Rawalpindi pitch used in 1st Pakistan-Australia Test rated below average by ICC
379.article_body: The pitch used in the recently-concluded Pakistan-Australia Test in Rawalpindi has been rated 'below average' by ICC match referee Ranjan Madugalle. Consequently, the venue has received one demerit point under the ICC Pitch and Outfield Monitoring Process. Madugalle said, "Pitch didn't have a great deal of pace and bounce in it for...seamers nor assisted the spinners as the match progressed."

380.title: Tesla to pay salary for 3 months to Ukrainian employees called to fight Russia
380.article_body: Elon Musk-led Tesla will pay its Ukrainian employees, who are asked to return to Ukraine to defend their country following the Russian invasion, for at least three months, according to a company e-mail seen by CNBC. The e-mail was sent to Tesla employees in Europe, the Middle East and Africa region. Tesla will reassess the situation in three months.

381.title: I did 'Gangubai Kathiawadi' for experience with Bhansali: Alia
381.article_body: Actress Alia Bhatt has stated that she did the film 'Gangubai Kathiawadi' for the experience with filmmaker Sanjay Leela Bhansali. She further said she has wanted to work with him since she was nine years old, adding she was fulfilling that childhood dream. "As a little girl and as an actor, it's the most grateful I've ever felt," Alia said.

382.title: Woman falls between moving train & platform, gets rescued by police
382.article_body: A female passenger fell between a train and a platform while trying to leave a moving train in Maharashtra, the Free Press Journal reported. A video of the incident shows the woman being immediately rescued by Head Constable Anil Upadhyay, who was seen dragging her towards him. The passenger explained that she jumped in 'panic' after boarding the wrong train.

383.title: 8 new police stations set up in West Bengal's North 24 Parganas
383.article_body: Eight new police stations have been formed in the Barrackpore Police Commissionerate area in North 24 Parganas district by the West Bengal government, an official said. He added that while Dakshineswar was formed out of Belghoria and Baranagar police station areas, the Nagerbazar police station was carved out of Dumdum. Naihati saw the formation of Shibdaspur and Halisahar police stations.

384.title: BJP crosses halfway mark, to retain power for 2nd consecutive term in Uttarakhand
384.article_body: BJP will retain power for the second consecutive term in Uttarakhand after the party crossed the halfway mark of 35 seats in the state Assembly election. However, CM Pushkar Singh Dhami has lost to Congress candidate Bhuwan Chandra Kapri from the Khatima assembly seat. Congress has currently secured victory in 15 assembly seats and is leading in four.

385.title: CSK share pictures from Rahul Chahar's haldi ceremony
385.article_body: CSK took to Twitter to share pictures from cricketer Rahul Chahar's haldi ceremony. Rahul, who is the cousin brother of CSK's Deepak Chahar, got married to his longtime girlfriend Ishani on Wednesday. "When Deepak brought out the Yellove in Rahul!" CSK captioned the pictures. Rahul was part of India's T20 World Cup squad.

386.title: Thumping majority seal of people's faith in PM Modi's policies: UP CM Yogi
386.article_body: UP CM Yogi Adityanath tweeted, "Dedicated to good governance, security and nationalism, under PM Narendra Modi's guidance, the historic victory of BJP alliance in UP has been ensured." He added, "This thumping majority is a seal of unwavering faith of the common people on the policies of the PM."  BJP alliance won 135 seats and is leading on 137 seats.

387.title: Cong needs self-introspection: Party MP on Assembly poll results
387.article_body: Reacting to Assembly poll results in five states, Congress Lok Sabha MP Benny Behanan said that party needs to introspect on its performance. "Congress must now learn from...failure of this election [and]...unification of anti-BJP votes in all states...should be led by Congress," he added. Congress will face challenges if it doesn't prepare itself to act on reality, Behanan further said.

388.title: Will go with Kumble-Harbhajan over Ashwin-Jadeja: Karim on spin-pairing
388.article_body: Asked to choose between spin-bowling pair of Anil Kumble-Harbhajan Singh and Ravichandran Ashwin-Ravindra Jadeja, Saba Karim said he will choose the former. "I feel that era was more challenging. In today's era...cricket is evolving but the standard of batting has fallen against spin," he added. Kumble-Harbhajan scalped 501 wickets in 54 Tests, while Ashwin-Jadeja have 424 wickets in 42 Tests.

389.title: Pic shows injured pregnant woman being rescued after Russian strike hit hospital
389.article_body: An image shows an injured pregnant woman being rescued from the rubble after a Russian strike on a Ukrainian maternity hospital. The attack in Mariupol, which is reported to have left at least 17 people wounded, has been branded an "atrocity" by President Volodymyr Zelenskyy. Three people, including a child, were killed in the attack, reported local media citing officials.

390.title: Proud to be Bhagyashree's daughter, but here to make my name: Avantika
390.article_body: Actress Avantika Dassani in an interview has said that she is proud to be actress Bhagyashree's daughter but she is here to make her own name and identity with her work. "I am not going to say there is no pressure. I want to do it exactly the way my mother or brother (actor Abhimanyu Dassani) did it," Avantika added.

391.title: SP's Akhilesh Yadav wins his 1st Assembly election from Karhal
391.article_body: Samajwadi Party chief and former Uttar Pradesh CM Akhilesh Yadav won his first Assembly election from Karhal constituency on Thursday by over 67,000 votes, EC's data shows. His closest rival was BJP's SP Singh Baghel. To note, Karhal has voted for SP since 1993, except in 2002 when BJP managed to win from there. SP has won 29 Assembly seats.

392.title: Kapil Sharma congratulates Bhagwant, says, 'You won heart of Punjab'
392.article_body: Comedian-actor Kapil Sharma on Thursday congratulated Bhagwant Mann for AAP's victory in Punjab and wrote, "You not only won the elections but also the heart of Punjab." Sharma shared an image from his wedding featuring Mann on Instagram. "I pray to God that under your leadership Punjab will progress and achieve new heights," he wrote.

393.title: What was the biggest and lowest margin of victory in Punjab Assembly polls?
393.article_body: AAP's Aman Arora recorded biggest margin of victory in Punjab Assembly elections, winning Sunam constituency by a margin of 75,277 votes against Congress' Jaswinder Singh Dhiman. The lowest margin was recorded by AAP's Raman Arora, who won Jalandhar Central by 247 votes against Congress' Rajinder Beri. The second-lowest margin (466) was recorded by Congress' Sukhjinder Singh Randhawa.

394.title: 'Punjab waalo tussi kamaal kar ditta': Kejriwal on AAP's win
394.article_body: Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal on Thursday thanked voters of Punjab for delivering his party a win in the ongoing Assembly elections and said, "Punjab waalo tussi kamaal kar ditta." "Sukhbir Singh Badal lost, Captain Sahab lost, Channi Sahab lost, Parkash Singh Badal lost, Navjot Singh Sidhu lost, Bikram Singh Majithia lost. Punjab has done amazing," he further added.

395.title: People have put their stamp on Yogi ji's corruption free governance: Shah
395.article_body: Union Home Minister and BJP leader Amit Shah on Thursday expressed his "heartfelt gratitude to the people of Uttar Pradesh," after trends showed BJP's victory in UP Assembly elections. Shah said, "People have put their stamp on UP CM Yogi Adityanath ji's fear and corruption-free good governance." Notably, BJP has won 103 seats and leading in 149 seats in UP.

396.title: We aren't politicians, BJP's win in UP is no loss for us: Tikait
396.article_body: As trends showed BJP's win in Uttar Pradesh Assembly elections, Bharatiya Kisan Union leader Rakesh Tikait on Thursday said that BJP's victory in UP is not a loss of the BKU. Tikait said, "We are revolutionaries, activists. We are not politicians, so this is no win or loss for us." Notably, BJP has so far won 103 seats in UP.

397.title: Researchers suggest saffron was 1st domesticated in Bronze Age Greece
397.article_body: Researchers said artworks, genetics both pointed out that saffron or Crocus sativus, world's costliest spice, was first domesticated in Bronze Age Greece, around 1700 BC or earlier. Team revealed that artworks from ancient Greece's Minoan civilisation were likely the oldest to depict use of domesticated saffron. Scientists also found flowers with similar traits depicted on ceramics and cloth.

398.title: BBMP to float fresh tender to complete Ejipura flyover
398.article_body: The Bruhat Bengaluru Mahanagara Palike (BBMP) will float a fresh tender to complete the pending civil work for the construction of a flyover between Ejipura and Kendriya Sadan junction in Bengaluru's Koramangala. The development comes after the Karnataka government terminated the contract awarded to Simplex Infrastructures Limited. The firm had missed multiple project deadlines despite warnings.

399.title: Man stabs driver to death in Pune after suspecting affair with wife
399.article_body: A driver working at a bungalow in Maharashtra's Pune was allegedly stabbed to death by the caretaker of the same property. According to reports, the accused suspected the victim of having an illicit relationship with his wife and killed him after inviting him to an open plot for drinks. The accused was traced through technical intelligence and informants, police said.

400.title: Ukrainians defuse Russian bomb with bare hands & a water bottle, video viral
400.article_body: A video showing two specialists from Ukraine's State Emergency Service defusing an unexploded Russian bomb has gone viral online. In it, the two men are seen disarming the bomb with their bare hands and just a bottle of water. Middle East Institute programs director Charles Lister shared the clip saying the bomb was powerful enough to "flatten a building".
